page.title: 09Buckyette Guest House
page.content: Buckyette is a guest house and it is very nice. Buckyette has 7 bedrooms and 84 beds, including some in flats that were barns. The house is 114 years old. The cooking is done by them and it is all fresh including their bread. I would like to stay there. All the rooms were polished and attractive, especially the mixture of modern and old furniture. It is a very historic place on the site of a Domesday village with a spring which they still use for drinking. They have an old butter cooler made of stone. They have 51 acres and they rent it out for grazing. They puppy-walk guide-dogs, who were excited and friendly and jumped up at us. They have a bronze medal for puppy-walking. The owners are very kind and we think it would be a good place for people from a city to stay.
